dublin_core.dcvalue: Laferrière, T. & Breuleux, A. (2017). The Digital Use Divide and Knowledge Building In Smith, B. K., Borge, M., Mercier, E., and Lim, K. Y. (Eds.). (2017). Making a Difference: Prioritizing Equity and Access in CSCL, 12th International Conference on Computer Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL) 2017, Volume 2. Philadelphia, PA: International Society of the Learning Sciences.

This paper delves into the digital divide challenge through an interaction analysis of educational partners engaged in co-designing, sustaining, and scaling classroom-based innovation using collaborative platforms in rural settings. The innovation is analyzed by referring to an emerging multilevel multiscale model, with emphasis on the five dimensions of Dede’s conceptual framework (Depth, Sustainability, Spread, Shift [in Ownership], and Evolution, 2006). Organizational structures, interaction processes put in place and the technology in use during the Remote Networked School (RNS) initiative are identified.
Philadelphia, PA: International Society of the Learning Sciences.
